headline: What Does Trump's Tariff Hike Mean for Consumer Goods Investors?
summary: This past week, President Donald Trump announced his full plan for tariffs on imports -- a list of duties varying by country that could make a wide range of goods pricier for U.S. companies and consumers.  The concern for investors is that these higher prices will weigh on corporate earnings in two ways.  First, higher prices will hurt consumers' buying power, leaving them with less to spend on discretionary items.

headline: History Says the Best Time to Buy Stocks May Be Coming
summary: President Donald Trump's trade wars are creating significant uncertainty, while many fear that a recession might be coming -- something else that could send the stock market in the wrong direction.  The Nasdaq Composite and S&P 500 have both recently hit correction territory -- defined as a 10% drop from their most recent highs.  Predicting these things is hard, but a bear market is a real possibility.

headline: Amazon.com (NasdaqGS:AMZN) Slips 11% Over The Week Amid Tariff Concerns
summary: Amazon.com (NasdaqGS:AMZN) saw a significant share price decline of 11% over the past week, amidst a turbulent market roiled by intensified tariff concerns initiated by President Trump's recent announcements. Despite Amazon's bid to acquire TikTok grabbing headlines, market dynamics were largely overshadowed by broader economic fears as the Nasdaq entered bear market territory. The market plunged by 9.4% with tariffs contributing substantially to investors' unease, affecting various sectors...

headline: 3 Top Bargain Tech Stocks Ready for the Next Bull Run
summary: Following President Donald Trump's "Liberation Day" tariff announcement, stocks plummeted as fears escalated regarding a potential global trade war and how it could impact the global economy.  While there certainly could be more pressure on stocks in the coming weeks depending on how this all plays out, it also has created some solid entry points for several top tech stocks where investors can start to at least dip their toes into the stocks.  Let's look at three bargain tech stocks investors can consider buying now.

headline: 2 No-Brainer Artificial Intelligence (AI) Stocks Owned by Warren Buffett Right Now
summary: Most people don't think of these companies as AI businesses, but when you dig deeper, few companies stand to benefit as much from the AI revolution as these two Buffett stocks.  Few companies are as directly exposed to rising demand for AI than Amazon (NASDAQ: AMZN).  To understand why this is, zoom out and look at how the AI industry functions.

headline: 1 Growth Stock Down 25% to Buy Right Now
summary: The markets were already on edge with concerns regarding tariffs, and President Donald Trump's "Liberation Day" tariff announcement sent them over the edge.  While there could be some continued market pain, the sell-off has also brought some top growth stocks down to attractive levels.  One growth stock now down 25% to start buying right now is Amazon (NASDAQ: AMZN).
